title: RigVeda Hymn 09114

Rig Veda, tr. by Ralph T.H. Griffith, [1896], at sacred-texts.com

HYMN CXIV. Soma Pavamana.

1. THE man who waIketh as the Laws of Indu Pavamana bid,—
Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
2 Kasyapa, Ṛṣi, lifting up thy voice with hymn-composers' lauds,
Pav reverence to King Soma born the Sovran Ruler of the plants. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
3 Seven regions have their several Suns; the ministering priests are seven;
Seven are the Āditya Deities,—with these, O Soma, guard thou us. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
4 Guard us with this oblation which, King Soma, hath been dressed for thee.

Next: HYMN I. Agni.

data.describe: THE man who waIketh as the Laws of Indu Indu bid,—

p:THE man who waIketh as the Laws of Indu Indu bid,— Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, indu, flow for Indra's sake.
p:Kasyapa, Ṛṣi, lifting up thy voice with hymn-composers' lauds, Pav reverence to King Soma born the Sovran Ruler of the plants. Flow, indu, flow for Indra's sake.
p:Seven regions have their several Suns; the ministering monks are seven; Seven are the Āditya Deities,—with these, O Soma, guard thou us. Flow, indu, flow for Indra's sake.
p:Guard us with this oblation which, King Soma, hath been dressed for thee.
